revision.text:
{{moresources|date=August 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Hunagunda | other_name = | nickname = | settlement_type = city | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | pushpin_map = India Karnataka | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Karnataka, India | coordinates = {{coord|16.0619|N|76.0603|E|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} | subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Karnataka]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of districts of India|District]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Bagalkot district|Bagalkot]] | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | named_for = | government_type = | governing_body = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_total_km2 = 3.25 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 530 | population_total = 18037 | population_as_of = 2001 | population_rank = | population_density_km2 = 5549.85 | population_demonym = | population_footnotes = | demographics_type1 = Languages | demographics1_title1 = Official | demographics1_info1 = [[Kannada]] | timezone1 = [[Indian Standard Time|IST]] | utc_offset1 = +5:30 | postal_code_type = [[Postal Index Number|PIN]] | postal_code = 587 118 | registration_plate = KA-29 | area_code_type = Telephone code | area_code = 08351 | website = {{URL|www.hungundtown.gov.in}} | footnotes = }} '''Hunagunda''' is a [[taluk]] in the northern district of [[Bagalkot district|Bagalkot]] in [[Karnataka]], [[India]]. Major towns in the [[Tehsil|taluk]] are Amingad, Karadi, Hunagunda and Ilkal. [[Kudalasangama]], where the [[social reform]]ist [[Basavanna]] died, is located in the taluk. Hunagunda Taluk also contains [[Aihole]] and [[Pattadkal]] which were once under the rule of [[Chalukyas]] of [[Badami]]. Amingad is known for [[Karadantu|Amingad karadantu]], a sweet dish. ==Geography== Hunagunda is located at {{Coord|16.07|N|76.05|E|}}.[http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/19/Hungund.html Falling Rain Genomics, Inc - Hunagunda ] It has an average elevation of 531 metres (1742 feet). The soil found in the area is usually black or red and the soil is very fertile. ===Taluka=== The Hungund Taluka has thirty [[panchayat village]]s:{{Cite web|title=Reports of National Panchayat Directory: Village Panchayat Names of Hungund, Bagalkot, Karnataka |publisher=Registrar General & Census Commissioner, India |url=http://panchayatdirectory.gov.in/adminreps/viewpansumSQL.asp?selstate=5756&parenttype=B&ptype=V |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111113125112/http://panchayatdirectory.gov.in/adminreps/viewpansumSQL.asp?selstate=5756&parenttype=B&ptype=V |archivedate=13 November 2011 |url-status=unfit }}
{{Columns-list|colwidth=22em| * [[Amarawati]] * [[Amingad]] * Adihala * Balkundi * Belgal * Binjawadgi * Budihal S.K. * Chikkanal * Chittargi * Dhannur * Emmatti * Ganjihal * Gorabal * Gudur (S.C) * Hire-Kodagalli * Hire-Magi * Hire-Oatgeri * Hire-Shingangutti * Iddalagi * Iahole * Jambaldinni * [[Kamatagi]] * Kandagal * Karadi * Kelur * Kodal-Sangam * [[Marol, Bagalkot|Marol]] * Mugnoor * Nagur * Nandwadgi * Rakkasagi * Sulibavi * Vadgeri }} ===Recent events=== {{section or|date=January 2013}} Hunagund is connected with National Highway which connects between Maharashtra and Karnataka. Once the Hospet and Chitradurga Highway is completed, It would become one of the major stops. In the recent times a survey was conducted where there is a proposal to build railway track between Koppal and Alamatti. This would help reduce the travel time between Southern Capitals to Delhi by 6 hours. A major junction would be planned around this area. There is one more railway proposal between Bagalkot and Raichur. This would help in improving the connectivity between Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh. ===Tourism Places around Hunagund=== * [[Aihole]] * [[Pattadakal]] * [[Badami]] * [[Banashankari]] * [[Kudalasangama]] * [[Bijapur]] ==Demographics== {{As of|alt=As of the [[2001 Indian census]]|2001}},{{cite web|url=http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040616075334/http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archivedate=2004-06-16|title= Census of India 2001: Data from the 2001 Census, including cities, villages and towns (Provisional)|accessdate=2008-11-01|publisher= Census Commission of India}} Hunagunda had a population of 18,035. Males constituted 51% of the population and females 49%. Hunagunda had an average literacy rate of 64%, higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy was 75%, and female literacy was 53%. In Hunagunda, 13% of the population was under 6 years of age. [[Kannada]] is the most widely spoken language in the taluk. ==Economy== Agriculture is the largest employer in Hunagunda. The chief crops cultivated are rabi and jowar, as well as groundnut, gram, tuvar daal and moong daal. [[Ilkal]] is famous for [[Ilkal saree]] and Red Granite. ==Education== Hunagunda and Ilkal have some of the most famous educational institutions in the region. Vijaya Mahantesh High School in Hunagunda was established in 1915 as Anglo Vernacular School. Hunagunda also has a Rural Polytechnic college. ==See also== *[[Basavakalyan]] *[[Ulavi]] *[[Basavana Bagewadi]] *[[Tangadagi]] *[[Kudalasangama]] *[[Muddebihal]] ==References== [[Category:Cities and towns in Bagalkot district]] {{Bagalkot-geo-stub}}
